1574000003_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc3.body:
Individuals don't "live" on their own. Quarks don't "live" on their own. Atoms don't "live" on their own. It's the nature of life to coagulate into higher order structures -- molecules, family units, plants, solar systems, etc.... Fractal through and through

Now -- it helps to pretend they exist as a mental exercise as a unit of analysis. Our brain can chew on smaller bites like that. But if you get hung up on the trees, then you're no longer a balanced individual.

you're right but you're not right.

to see the particulars and not see the universals is a form of lop-sided thinking that only our universities are capable of producing

to see the universals and not the particulars is a form of lop-sided thinking that many religious conservatives fall into

now -- try opening both eyes at the same time to get binocular vision. To put everything in its rightful place
